value.title: We will see a completely new type of computer, says AI pioneer Geoff Hinton
value.excerpt: Analog computers marrying AI software closely to hardware will put GPT-3 in your toaster for $1 running on a few watts of power.

value.title: DeepMind's New AI Uses Game Theory to Trounce Humans in 'Stratego'

value.title: Operationalize your Amazon SageMaker Studio notebooks as scheduled notebook jobs
value.excerpt: Amazon SageMaker Studio provides a fully managed solution for data scientists to interactively build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models. In addition to the interactive ML experience, data workers also seek solutions to run notebooks as ephemeral jobs without the need to refactor code as

value.title: Facial strain sensor could give a voice to the voiceless
value.excerpt: While some assistance is available to individuals who lack the power of speech, verbally communicating with other people can still be challenging. A new face-worn strain sensor could help, as it's able to "read" the wearer's silently mouthed words.

value.title: AI could have 20% chance of sentience in 10 years, says philosopher David Chalmers
value.excerpt: AI programs that combine sensing and action and world models might achieve fish-level intelligence, says the NeurIPS 2022 keynote speaker.

value.title: Artificial intelligence and robotics to help early detect urinary tract infections
value.excerpt: A team of researchers at the University of Edinburgh and Heriot-Watt University are developing AI and robots to detect urinary tract infections (UTIs) earlier.

value.title: Using Advanced Technology And Analytics To Fight Financial Crime
value.excerpt: Financial services organizations increasingly are using advanced ... to increase efficiency in identifying suspicious activities. Among various analytics, machine learning (ML) has been particularly effective, as it can identify patterns of behavior ...

value.title: New Orleans reverses facial recognition ban to help police fight crime; privacy experts are wary
value.excerpt: The City of New Orleans has ended a ban on the use of facial recognition technology by police amid a surge in violent crime. Critics of the move have questions.

value.title: AWS CEO Selipsky: We Are Making Cloud Easier To Use
value.excerpt: What businesses need from cloud computing is the power to work on their data without having to transport it around between different clouds, different databases and different repositories, different integrations to third-party applications,

value.title: N-iX obtains the Modernization of Web Applications to Microsoft Azure Advanced Specialization
value.excerpt: N-iX, a leading European software development company, has earned the Modernization of Web Applications to Microsoft Azure advanced specialization. It is a validation of the company's deep knowledge and extensive experience in migrating and modernizing production web application workloads and managing app services in Azure.

value.title: AI Is Coming for the Thought Leaders
value.excerpt: Robots were considered capable only of unimaginative, routine work. Today they write articles and create award-winning art.

value.title: The Pros And Cons Of Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence, or AI, is everywhere right now. In truth, the fundamentals of AI and machine learning have been around for a long time. The first primitive form of AI was an automated checkers bot which was created by Cristopher Strachey from the University of Manchester, England, back in 1951.

value.title: AWS updates its machine learning service SageMaker
value.excerpt: Invent 2022, the cloud services provider updated its managed machine learning service to include new notebook and governance features.

value.title: DigiYatra facial recognition system launches at airports: How this will change security
value.excerpt: DigiYatra, the brainchild of the Ministry of Civil Aviation, allows airline passengers to be automatically processed based on a facial recognition system at several checkpoints including entry, security check and boarding aircraft.

value.title: All the Actually Important Stuff Neuralink Just Announced

value.title: Disney Developed An AI Tool That Can Make Actors Look Younger On Video With Just One Click
value.excerpt: New research by Disney Research Studios, which focuses on technology innovations for filmmaking, shows off a new face aging network, named FRAN, that simplifies the aging process of actors in video.

value.title: AWS unveils machine learning (ML) tools for data science in the cloud
value.excerpt: Amazon Web Services (AWS) detailed parts of its AI/ML strategy and announced a dizzying lineup of feature updates and new services to help organizations to better use the cloud for data science.

value.title: AWS Introduces Amazon Security Lake and AWS Clean Rooms
value.excerpt: Invent 2022: Amazon Security Lake and AWS Clean Rooms. Amazon Security Lake is a service that automatically centralizes an organization’s security data from cloud and on-premises sources into a purpose-built data lake in a customer’s AWS account,

value.title: Mastering Stratego, the classic game of imperfect information
value.excerpt: Game-playing artificial intelligence (AI) systems have advanced to a new frontier. Stratego, the classic board game that’s more complex than chess and Go, and craftier than poker, has now been mastered. value.title: Stability AI doubles down on AWS
value.excerpt: Generative AI startups Stability AI today announced that AWS is now its preferred cloud partner for building and deploying its models.

value.title: San Francisco's Killer Robots Threaten the City's Most Vulnerable
value.excerpt: Law enforcement says that in some scenarios a lethal robot is the only way to protect public safety. Experts say the policy will harm communities of color.

value.title: You can use an AI Time Machine to see what you'd look like in different eras throughout history
value.excerpt: A TikTok trend popularized the MyHeritage's AI Time Machine, which generates realistic photos of what you would have looked like in past eras.

value.title: How the Private Sector Can Help Close The Public Sector AI Knowledge Gap
value.excerpt: This blog focuses on how the private sector can help close the public sector knowledge gap in sustainable AI practices. 5 Strategies are positioned for consideration, underlying the security threats we face of not modernizing our government institutions more rapidly with sustaining AI capabilities.
